e4: Adopting the new policy ensures that reported earnings are transparent and unbiased, aligning with ethical standards and reducing potential legal liabilities. It may initially cause some investor confusion, but it ultimately builds long-term trust and credibility with the investment community by prioritizing honest reporting practices.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and honesty, ensuring all stakeholders have clear and correct information. It should prevent any misleading conclusions, maintain regulatory compliance, and treat all investors equitably regardless of their sophistication level. Ethical reporting builds trust and supports informed decision-making in the financial community.
e6: What strategies will be implemented to effectively communicate the policy change to all investors, ensuring understanding and minimizing confusion? How does the management plan to monitor and evaluate the impacts of this change on investor relations and trading behavior? What steps will be taken to address any unintended consequences?
